file_content.text: You've made it. Good. Time is short--so is reliable assistance.
As if I don't have enough to contend with, Agent Kovach has gone missing. We'll have to do without him, so I've reached out to another ally.
Since you have decided in your infinite wisdom to execute Agent Kovach, I've reached out to someone you might be less likely to kill.
As Agent Kovach is no longer in the picture, I've taken the liberty of reaching out to someone I hope we can trust a little bit better.
I have Agent Kovach assembling a suppression team out of whatever droids he can find, so I approached another agent to assist us.
Are you in position?
Yeah, but this setup isn't anything like what you described.
So what you're saying is you can't figure it out.
Don't get all-- I'll figure it out.
We're about to begin, so that would be nice.
What exactly are we about to begin, Lana?
You're going to make Vitiate angry. So angry that he'll place all his attention on killing you.
When the time comes, you'll lead him to an electrostatic weapon stored here, in the heart of New Adasta.
It's meant to be a last resort against major civil uprisings, but Theron's modifying it to be non-lethal. With the reduced charge, its radius of impact will diminish.
You have a weapon designed with the sole purpose of killing your own people?
Meant to be what?
You really ought to think about switching sides.
Pick a new team, Lana.
I think I need to pretend I didn't hear that.
Moving on....
Fine. Let's get started.
Yes. Let's.
It's not as if we install one in every metropolis. We nearly lost New Adasta to unrest once before.
I'm afraid I haven't much use for a democracy. Far too messy.
Shall we get started?
Vitiate!
Only the weakest prey on the weak.
Attention former Sith Emperor! Your repeated and horrific crimes against the Republic and innocent civilians throughout the galaxy will not go unpunished.
Now, see, here's my thing.
For all your claims to power, for all your smug superiority, you hack away at the defenseless like a gleeful child.
Hear me, Vitiate.
Hey. You. Hope I'm not interrupting.
Am I interrupting? Yes?
Thought you'd be interested--I found something. A large weapon, here in the middle of everything. I'm going to use it to destroy you.
Such a big, powerful killing machine--and yet here I am. Little old me, still alive. What's the matter, "Emperor"? Lost your nerve?
All your airs of immeasurable power, yet all I see is the manipulation of the weak-minded. The slaughter of the infirm.
And here I stand--your own Wrath, in defiance of your plans--and you do nothing. Use whatever reason you want, but I know the truth.
You go around, acting all big and scary... but look at who you're scaring. Slim pickings, you ask me.
On the authority of the Army of the Galactic Republic, I hereby notify you of your impending annihilation.
Imagine how much more powerful you would be if you struck me down. Well?
I am the Battlemaster of the Jedi Order. I've struck you down once already. Today, I'm finishing the job.
I think that did it.
I have to go now. There's much to be done. Too much. I shouldn't have come here, truth be told.
There's nothing wrong with wanting to see someone you've missed--especially in times like these.
[Flirt] Sure you should have.
Then go. No one's stopping you.
Leave already.
Be strong, stay focused. You'll be fine.
You can do this.
No need to linger on my account. I'll get it done.
Go ahead. I'll be fine.
I didn't think I'd ever see you again. Even under these circumstances, it's nice to be wrong.
[Flirt] Sure you should have.
Don't think I've forgotten that you killed my agent for virtually no reason. Still... it is good to see you.
If all this ever ends, maybe then....
That it is. May the Force serve you well.
May the Force serve you well.
Thank you. We'll see if you're right.
I imagine you will. May the Force serve you well.
Well, in that case....
Boy, you can really kill 'em, can't you? Sure, they've got to be untrained, defenseless and standing still, but yeah.
You conveniently avoid the true challenge. The one you cannot match wills with. The one you cannot hope to strike down. Come--and be tested.
You are a coward.
A little on the nose, don't you think?
We did want his attention.
Whatever you truly are--whatever power you think you have--it won't save you from me.
Today, you will face justice.
Even I'm not scared of you. How pathetic is that? I don't know... maybe you're overcompensating for something?
